Feather River Instream Flow to Habitat Area Relationship

Source: R/data.R
feather_river_instream.Rd

A dataset containing the Weighted Usable Area (WUA) in square feet per 1000 feet as a function of flow in cubic feet per second

feather_river_instream

Format

dataframe with 7 rows and 5 variables:

flow_cfs

integer flow value in cubic feet per second

FR_spawn_wua

spawning WUA in square feet per 1000 feet

FR_fry_wua

fry (up to 50 mm) WUA in square feet per 1000 feet

FR_juv_wua

juvenile WUA in square feet per 1000 feet

ST_spawn_wua

steelhead spawning WUA in square feet per 1000 feet

watershed

name of watershed

Source

Spawning: FERC 2004 Rearing: Payne 2002

Details

The spawning and rearing WUA values were derived from a PHABSIM model. The results are for Fall Run.

Examples

feather_river_instream
#> # A tibble: 18 x 6
#>    flow_cfs FR_spawn_wua FR_fry_wua FR_juv_wua ST_spawn_wua watershed    
#>       <dbl>        <dbl>      <dbl>      <dbl>        <dbl> <chr>
